articles.title: BBVA and OpenAI collaborate to transform global banking
articles.summary: BBVA has partnered with OpenAI to revolutionize global banking by leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning. This collaboration aims to enhance customer experiences, improve operational efficiency, and develop innovative financial services. By integrating OpenAI's technology, BBVA seeks to stay at the forefront of the banking industry's digital transformation.

articles.title: BNY builds “AI for everyone, everywhere” with OpenAI
articles.summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with OpenAI to make artificial intelligence more accessible, aiming to bring "AI for everyone, everywhere" through innovative solutions. This collaboration is expected to drive widespread adoption of AI technology, bridging the gap between businesses and individuals. By democratizing AI, BNY Mellon and OpenAI hope to unlock new opportunities and transform industries.

articles.title: How We Used Codex to Ship Sora for Android in 28 Days
articles.summary: The developers of Sora used Codex, an AI-powered coding tool, to rapidly develop and ship the Android version of their app in just 28 days. Codex's automated coding capabilities enabled the team to work more efficiently, reducing development time and allowing them to focus on fine-tuning the app's features. This achievement demonstrates the potential of AI-powered tools to accelerate mobile app development and deployment.

articles.title: Advancing science and math with GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a cutting-edge AI model that promises to revolutionize science and math education by providing personalized learning experiences and automated grading. This innovative technology has the potential to enhance student understanding and teacher productivity. With GPT-5.2, complex concepts can be broken down into interactive and engaging lessons, making STEM subjects more accessible and fun for learners.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2
articles.summary: The latest iteration of OpenAI's language model, GPT-5.2, has been introduced, boasting improved performance and capabilities in generating human-like text. This update enhances the model's ability to understand and respond to complex queries, further blurring the line between human and artificial intelligence. With GPT-5.2, users can expect more accurate and coherent interactions with AI-powered systems.

articles.title: Improved Gemini audio models for powerful voice experiences
articles.summary: Google has enhanced its Gemini audio models, enabling more accurate and efficient voice recognition capabilities. This innovation allows for powerful voice experiences, including improved speech-to-text functionality and enhanced voice assistants. The upgraded models will likely enhance various applications, from virtual assistants to transcription services.

articles.title: Deepening our partnership with the UK AI Security Institute
articles.summary: A leading tech company is strengthening its partnership with the UK AI Security Institute to advance AI security research and development. This collaboration aims to enhance the security and trustworthiness of AI systems, driving innovation and growth in the field. By combining their expertise, they will work towards creating more robust and reliable AI solutions.

articles.title: Strengthening our partnership with the UK government to support prosperity and security in the AI era
articles.summary: A major tech company has announced a strengthened partnership with the UK government to drive AI innovation and support national prosperity and security. This collaboration aims to harness AI's potential to boost economic growth, improve public services, and enhance cybersecurity. By working together, the company and the UK government seek to establish the country as a global leader in responsible AI development and deployment.

articles.title: FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive evaluation tool designed to assess the factuality of large language models. This suite aims to systematically test the accuracy and reliability of AI-generated content, providing a standardized framework for measuring factuality. By using FACTS, developers can better identify and mitigate the spread of misinformation generated by language models.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to withstand the challenges of a warming climate, using advanced engineering techniques to enhance their ability to thrive in extreme temperatures and weather conditions. This innovation aims to improve global food security by creating crops that can adapt to rising temperatures and changing precipitation patterns. By doing so, researchers hope to reduce crop losses and ensure a more sustainable food supply for the future.

articles.title: New in llama.cpp: Model Management
articles.summary: The latest update to llama.cpp introduces model management capabilities, allowing users to easily manage and switch between different AI models. This innovation enhances the flexibility and customization of the llama.cpp framework, enabling developers to adapt to various use cases and applications. By streamlining model management, users can now focus on fine-tuning and optimizing their AI models for improved performance.

articles.title: Codex is Open Sourcing AI models
articles.summary: Codex, a leader in AI development, is open-sourcing its AI models, making them freely available for use and modification. This move is expected to accelerate innovation and collaboration in the AI community, driving advancements in areas like natural language processing and machine learning. By sharing its models, Codex aims to democratize access to AI technology and foster a more open and inclusive ecosystem.

articles.title: Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker: Cost-efficient Frontier Multimodal Performance
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker, a cutting-edge multimodal model that achieves frontier performance while being cost-efficient. This innovation enables more accessible and widespread adoption of AI technologies, particularly in areas like computer vision and natural language processing. By reducing computational costs, Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker has the potential to drive significant advancements in various applications, from image recognition to language translation.

articles.title: Introducing swift-huggingface: The Complete Swift Client for Hugging Face
articles.summary: The Hugging Face team has released swift-huggingface, a comprehensive Swift client that enables seamless integration of their popular AI models into iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS apps. This new client allows developers to easily leverage Hugging Face's vast model repository, including language models and computer vision models, to build innovative AI-powered applications. By bridging the gap between Hugging Face and Swift, developers can now create more intelligent and interactive user experiences on Apple devices.

articles.title: DeepMath: A lightweight math reasoning Agent with smolagents
articles.summary: DeepMath, a revolutionary AI agent, leverages smolagents to provide lightweight math reasoning capabilities, making it a significant breakthrough in artificial intelligence. This innovation enables efficient and accurate math problem-solving, paving the way for various applications in education and research. By combining smolagents with deep learning, DeepMath achieves impressive results while minimizing computational resources.

articles.title: macOS 26.2 enables fast AI clusters with RDMA over Thunderbolt
articles.summary: macOS 26.2 introduces a significant update, enabling fast AI clusters with RDMA (Remote Direct Memory Access) over Thunderbolt, allowing for high-speed data transfer and accelerated AI processing. This innovation enables developers to create powerful AI clusters using multiple Macs connected via Thunderbolt, boosting performance and efficiency. The update has the potential to revolutionize AI development and deployment on macOS devices.

articles.title: OpenAI are quietly adopting skills, now available in ChatGPT and Codex CLI
articles.summary: OpenAI has introduced a new feature called "skills" in ChatGPT and Codex CLI, allowing users to access a range of specialized capabilities and tools within the platforms. This update enables more precise and efficient interactions, as users can now invoke specific skills to accomplish tasks such as language translation or code generation. The integration of skills enhances the overall functionality and versatility of OpenAI's tools.

articles.title: Bit flips: How cosmic rays grounded a fleet of aircraft
articles.summary: A recent incident involving a fleet of aircraft being grounded was caused by "bit flips," a phenomenon where cosmic rays alter the binary code in computer systems, leading to errors and malfunctions. This rare occurrence highlights the vulnerability of modern technology to cosmic radiation, which can have significant impacts on safety-critical systems. The incident serves as a reminder of the need for robust error correction and radiation-hardening measures in sensitive electronics.

articles.title: Using secondary school maths to demystify AI
articles.summary: Researchers are using secondary school-level math concepts to explain complex AI principles, making AI more accessible and demystifying its underlying technology. This approach aims to provide a deeper understanding of AI without requiring advanced math knowledge, promoting a more inclusive and transparent AI community. By leveraging familiar math concepts, individuals can better comprehend and engage with AI, bridging the gap between technical experts and the general public.
